page.title: 13STRETTON HOUSING
page.content: THE HOUSES IN STRETTON ARE VERY VARIED. THERE ARE SOME WHICH DATE FROM THE{1600'S}AND WHICH ARE TYPICALLY {TUDOR}IN STYLE, THROUGH TO SOME{NEW {BUNGALOWS}BUILT IN{1985.}THE HOUSES COVER EVERY TYPE AND SIZE FROM SMALL TERRACED COTTAGES TO LARGE DETACHED MANOR HOUSES. IN THE VILLAGE THERE ARE ALSO TWO FARMS STILL USED AS FARMS AND TWO WHICH ARE NOW PRIVATE HOUSES. STRETTON HAS TWO NEW ESTATES, ONE ALONG PLOTT LANE AND ONE NEAR BROOKSIDE. THE ONE ALONG PLOTT LANE HAS 40 DETACHED HOUSES. THEY ARE THREE YEARS OLD AND WERE BUILT BY BRYANTS BUILDERS. THE SMALL ESTATE NEAR BROOKSIDE IS CALLED KAYSBROOK DRIVE AND CONSISTS OF FOUR DETACHED BUNGALOWS. ALONG FOSSE WAY AND MEADOW CLOSE THERE ARE COUNCIL HOUSES BUT SEVERAL OF THESE HAVE NOW BEEN BOUGHT BY THE PREVIOUS TENANTS.
